object.name: InlineQueryResultDocument
object.description:
Represents a link to a file. By default, this file will be sent by the user with an optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the file. Currently, only .PDF and .ZIP files can be sent using this method.
Note: This will only work in Telegram versions released after 9 April, 2016. Older clients will ignore them.
object.html_description:
Represents a link to a file. By default, this file will be sent by the user with an optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the file. Currently, only .PDF and .ZIP files can be sent using this method.

Note: This will only work in Telegram versions released after 9 April, 2016. Older clients will ignore them.
object.rst_description:
Represents a link to a file. By default, this file will be sent by the user with an optional caption. Alternatively, you can use *input_message_content* to send a message with the specified content instead of the file. Currently, only **.PDF** and **.ZIP** files can be sent using this method.
**Note:** This will only work in Telegram versions released after 9 April, 2016. Older clients will ignore them.

annotations.description: Type of the result, must be document
annotations.rst_description: Type of the result, must be *document*
annotations.name: type

annotations.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes
annotations.rst_description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes
annotations.name: id

annotations.description: Caption of the document to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing
annotations.html_description: Optional. Caption of the document to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. Caption of the document to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing
annotations.name: caption

annotations.description: Mode for parsing entities in the document caption. See formatting options for more details.
annotations.html_description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the document caption. See formatting options for more details.
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. Mode for parsing entities in the document caption. See `formatting options <https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options>`_ for more details.
annotations.name: parse_mode

annotations.description: List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode
annotations.html_description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of *parse_mode*
annotations.name: caption_entities

annotations.description: A valid URL for the file
annotations.rst_description: A valid URL for the file
annotations.name: document_url

annotations.description: MIME type of the content of the file, either 'application/pdf' or 'application/zip'
annotations.html_description: MIME type of the content of the file, either “application/pdf” or “application/zip”
annotations.rst_description: MIME type of the content of the file, either 'application/pdf' or 'application/zip'
annotations.name: mime_type

annotations.description: Inline keyboard attached to the message
annotations.html_description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. Inline keyboard attached to the message
annotations.name: reply_markup

annotations.description: Content of the message to be sent instead of the file
annotations.html_description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the file
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. Content of the message to be sent instead of the file
annotations.name: input_message_content

annotations.description: URL of the thumbnail (JPEG only) for the file
annotations.html_description: Optional. URL of the thumbnail (JPEG only) for the file
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. URL of the thumbnail (JPEG only) for the file
annotations.name: thumbnail_url
